title: Craft Workshop | Taller de Manualidades
description:
Date: Wednesday, November 5, 2025
Time: 4:00pm - 5:00pm
Presenter: Amanda Dominguez
Location: PGML-Biblioteca Criolla

🎨 CALLING ALL CRAFTERS ✂️
 

Join us for a creative and fun-filled craft workshop celebrating learning, imagination, and creative reuse!

What’s in Store?
✨ Crafts made from recycled items
🎨 Beautiful fine art pieces 
🧸 Adorable plush items
🍬 Homemade sweet treats

Perfect for families, young creators, and craft lovers of all ages!

🌿 Learn. Create. Celebrate!

🎨 Taller de Manualidades "CALLING" ✂️
 

¡Acompáñanos en un taller de manualidades creativa y divertida que celebra el aprendizaje, la imaginación y la reutilización creativa!

¿Qué encontrarás?
✨ Manualidades hechas con materiales reciclados
🎨 Hermosas piezas de arte
🧸 Adorables peluches
🍬 Deliciosos dulces caseros

¡Perfecto para familias, jóvenes creadores y amantes de las manualidades de todas las edades!

🌿 ¡Aprende. Crea. Celebra!
categories: Popular Events > Arts and Crafts Events

title: Flamenco Classes
description:
Date: Thursday, November 6, 2025
Time: 5:00pm - 6:00pm
Presenter: Natallia Basava
Location: PGML-Biblioteca Criolla

Discover Flamenco!
Join us for a dynamic and engaging Flamenco dance class where you'll learn the essential techniques of this passionate and vibrant dance form! This class will focus on fundamental exercises to help you master footwork, body posture, and hand and arm movements.

Whether you're a complete beginner or have some dance experience, no prior dance background is required—everyone is welcome! Classes are open to adults and children ages 9 and up.

THESE CLASSES ARE THE PART OF "INVITATION TO FLAMENCO" PROGRAM, SUPPORTED BY PUBLIC FUNDS FROM THE JERSEY CITY ARTS AND CULTURE TRUST FUND

Bilingual instruction will be provided in both English and Spanish to ensure everyone feels comfortable learning.

Classes will be taught by the talented instructor, Natallia Basava.

Every Thursdays

At Biblioteca Criolla (4th Fl) in the PG Main Library 

472 Jersey Ave | Jersey City, NJ 07302   -   201-547-4541
categories: Popular Events > Music and Dance Events

title: Pre-School Storytime
description:
Date: Monday, November 3, 2025
Time: 10:30am - 11:00am
Location: Earl Morgan Branch

Get ready to wiggle, giggle, and explore the world of stories! Preschool Story Time is a lively, 30-minute program filled with picture books, rhymes, songs, and playful activities designed to spark curiosity and build early learning skills. This engaging experience supports language development and school readiness in a fun, social setting. Caregivers are welcome to join in the fun too!

 

*CLASS VISITS MUST BE SCHEDULED IN ADVANCE*

title: Pre-School Storytime
description:
Date: Wednesday, November 5, 2025
Time: 10:30am - 11:00am
Location: Earl Morgan Branch

title: Kidokinetics: Let's Get Active At The Library!
description:
Date: Wednesday, November 5, 2025
Time: 4:30pm - 5:30pm
Location: Earl Morgan Branch

An engaging introduction to sports designed to motivate children to be active and build confidence. The program includes a warm-up, introduction of a new sport or activity, free play, a cool-down session, and a lesson on age-appropriate anatomy and physiology. Incorporating music into movement for all ages is encouraged, enhancing listening and memory skills while enhancing the overall enjoyment of the experience. 

Ages 6-11

title: SEL Talks with Mrs. Smith
description:
Date: Saturday, November 8, 2025
Time: 12:00pm - 2:00pm
Location: Earl A Morgan Auditorium

Join us for SEL Talks with Mrs. Smith, an engaging program designed to help children build social-emotional learning (SEL) skills through the joy of reading and hands-on activities. Following a meaningful read-aloud, participants will engage in fun, interactive activities that encourage self-expression and empathy. Perfect for elementary and middle school readers.

title: National STEM Day
description:
Date: Saturday, November 8, 2025
Time: 3:00pm - 4:00pm
Location: Earl Morgan Branch

National STEM Day encourages interest in science, technology, engineering, and math through hands-on activities, experiments, and events that inspire innovation, creativity, and problem-solving in young minds.

Get ready to wiggle, giggle, and explore the world of stories! Preschool Story Time is a lively, 30-minute program filled with picture books, rhymes, songs, and playful activities designed to spark curiosity and build early learning skills. This engaging experience supports language development and school readiness in a fun, social setting. Caregivers are welcome to join in the fun too!

 

*CLASS VISITS MUST BE SCHEDULED IN ADVANCE*

title: Kidokinetics: Let's get Active at the Library!
description:
Date: Thursday, November 20, 2025
Time: 4:30pm - 5:30pm
Presenter: Kidokinetics
Location: Hamilton Park, Jersey City, NJ

An engaging introduction to sports designed to motivate children to be active and build confidence. The program includes a warm-up, introduction of a new sport or activity, free play, a cool-down session, and a lesson on age-appropriate anatomy and physiology. Incorporating music into movement for all ages is encouraged, enhancing listening and memory skills while enhancing the overall enjoyment of the experience.

For ages 3-11. 

For more info email pavoniabranch@jclibrary.org or call us at (201) 547-4808. 

*This event is in Hamilton Park

title: Afterschool Tutoring
description:
Date: Thursday, October 30, 2025
Time: 3:30pm - 5:30pm
Location: Miller Branch

Need a little extra help with homework? Our Afterschool Tutoring Program is here to support young learners in a fun, friendly, and encouraging environment! Tutors provide one-on-one and small group assistance. Whether your child is catching up, staying on track, or looking to get ahead, we’re here to help build confidence and academic skills.

title: Chess for Beginners (Ages 8+)*
description:
Date: Monday, November 3, 2025
Time: 4:30pm - 5:30pm
Location: Five Corners Branch- William J. Timney Room

Take lessons from a chess master, improve endgame play, practice positions, explore chess openings, or analyze and review games.

Unlock the magic of chess in a fun, imaginative, and beginner-friendly environment! Perfect for children with experience playing chess who would like to better their game and impress their friends and family with amazing chess skills! Session A begins Monday September 22 and runs for 4 weeks. Registration is in person ONLY. Please register with Miss Anna. Session B Begins October 27th and runs for 4 weeks. 

RULES: 

Registration opens September 8th. In Person registration only. 

Student must be able to attend all 4 sessions. 

Student must have experience playing some chess (no novices).
location: Five Corners Branch-  William J. Timney Room

title: Tiny Tots Open Play (Ages 0-5)
description:

Location: Five Corners Branch- Multipurpose Space (Foyer), Five Corners Branch- William J. Timney Room

title: Little Mover's Storytime
description:
Date: Thursday, November 6, 2025
Time: 11:00am - 12:00pm
Location: Five Corners Branch- Multipurpose Space (Foyer), Five Corners Branch- William J. Timney Room, Five Corners Branch- Mildred Hunke Auditorium

Join us for songs, fingerplays, and of course, books! This is a special time to bond with your little one and meet other caregivers. We will explore the joys of books, songs, and gentle movement in addition to building early learning skills you can practice at home. Come prepared to sit with your child on your lap. Best for children who are pre-walkers.

 

Registration is required and opens 24 hours early (Mondays at 11:00am) 

Events Calendar - Jersey City Free Public Library
location: Five Corners Branch-  Multipurpose Space (Foyer), Five Corners Branch-  William J. Timney Room, Five Corners Branch- Mildred Hunke Auditorium

title: Pixton and Graphic Novel Making (Ages 8+)*
description:
Date: Wednesday, November 12, 2025
Time: 4:00pm - 5:00pm
Location: Five Corners Branch- Multipurpose Space (Foyer), Five Corners Branch- Mildred Hunke Auditorium

Pixton is an effective writing tool with measured a successful impact on comic book making. Pair this with a Pilkey-style (Captain Underpants) style book making and you will be an author in no time. Ages 8+. Registration necessary.
location: Five Corners Branch-  Multipurpose Space (Foyer), Five Corners Branch- Mildred Hunke Auditorium

title: Little Mover's Storytime
description:
Date: Thursday, November 20, 2025
Time: 11:00am - 12:00pm
Location: Five Corners Branch- Multipurpose Space (Foyer), Five Corners Branch- William J. Timney Room, Five Corners Branch- Mildred Hunke Auditorium

Join us for songs, fingerplays, and of course, books! This is a special time to bond with your little one and meet other caregivers. We will explore the joys of books, songs, and gentle movement in addition to building early learning skills you can practice at home. Come prepared to sit with your child on your lap. Best for children who are pre-walkers.

 

Registration is required and opens 24 hours early (Mondays at 11:00am) 

Events Calendar - Jersey City Free Public Library
location: Five Corners Branch-  Multipurpose Space (Foyer), Five Corners Branch-  William J. Timney Room, Five Corners Branch- Mildred Hunke Auditorium

title: We're Back: A Dinosaur Story
description:
Date: Saturday, November 22, 2025
Time: 1:00pm - 4:30pm
Location: Five Corners Branch- Mildred Hunke Auditorium

A classic Thanksgiving movie! Four fun-loving dinosaurs take a trip to New York City, courtesy of Capt. Neweyes. The time-traveling alien is intent on bringing some joy to the lives of the children of the Big Apple. After eating a potion to boost their smarts and cuddliness, Tyrannosaurus Rex, Triceratops Woog, Pterodactyl Elsa and Hadrosaur Dweeb hit the town! But trouble soon arrives when Neweyes' evil brother hatches a devious plot. (G, 1hr 12min, 1993)
location: Five Corners Branch- Mildred Hunke Auditorium

title: Chess for Beginners (Ages 8+)*
description:
Date: Monday, November 24, 2025
Time: 4:30pm - 5:30pm
Location: Five Corners Branch- William J. Timney Room

Take lessons from a chess master, improve endgame play, practice positions, explore chess openings, or analyze and review games.

Unlock the magic of chess in a fun, imaginative, and beginner-friendly environment! Perfect for children with experience playing chess who would like to better their game and impress their friends and family with amazing chess skills! Session A begins Monday September 22 and runs for 4 weeks. Registration is in person ONLY. Please register with Miss Anna. Session B Begins October 27th and runs for 4 weeks. 

RULES: 

Registration opens September 8th. In Person registration only. 

Student must be able to attend all 4 sessions. 

Student must have experience playing some chess (no novices).
location: Five Corners Branch-  William J. Timney Room

title: Halloween Bash
description:
Date: Thursday, October 30, 2025
Time: 4:00pm - 5:30pm
Location: Communipaw Branch

Join us for a spooktacular party. We will have games, snacks and some spooky Halloween music. Come dressed in your own costume. Children 5 and under can get 1 free costume or a mask from our costume library.  (Supplies are first come first served)

For ages 2-5 years old with an adult.
